Best time to go: you can come to visit Duong Lam ancient village at any time of the year. However, the festival season and the ripe rice season are the most ideal, beautiful and interesting times.

BAT TRANG POTTERY VILLAGE.name: BAT TRANG POTTERY VILLAGE
BAT TRANG POTTERY VILLAGE.introduction: Bat Trang Pottery Village was formed from the Ly Dynasty, located on the left bank of the Red River. After nearly 1000 years of existence and development, Bat Trang Pottery Village today has become a professional-scale ceramic production center, with many large companies established alongside small household production units.
BAT TRANG POTTERY VILLAGE.location: Bat Trang Commune, Gia Lam District, Hanoi

description.title: General Introduction
content: According to the Complete Annals of Dai Viet and Nguyen Trai's Geography, Bat Trang Pottery Village was formed from the Ly Dynasty.

Besides products serving the spiritual life and worship of the Vietnamese people, the pottery kilns in Bat Trang also produce consumer, decorative, and display products with more modern designs, styles, and materials.
The masterpieces of Bat Trang ceramics today have been present everywhere in the Vietnamese market, and are also exported to many countries in Europe and Asia.

The most interesting thing when coming to Bat Trang Pottery Village is to watch the artisans perform the intricate and meticulous ceramic manufacturing process. In addition, you also get to experience making your favorite ceramic products.

description.title: History
content: Bat Trang Pottery Village is located in Bat Trang Commune, including Giang Cao Hamlet and Bat Trang Hamlet, in Gia Lam District, Hanoi City.

According to historical records, when the Ly Dynasty moved the capital from Hoa Lu to Thang Long, the people of Bat Trang migrated along. When they reached near the capital, seeing the fertile alluvial land on the Red River bank, they decided to settle there and together created the pottery making craft.

Throughout nearly 1000 years of history, the pottery village has gone through many events and ups and downs. However, thanks to the perseverance and hard work of the people and artisans here, the pottery village still exists and develops to this day.

description.title: Visiting Points
content: Bat Trang Ancient Village: Walking around the ancient village area, along the dyke road, or going into the small alleys is one of the interesting things when coming to Bat Trang Pottery Village. The ceramic drying racks along the village road, the moss-covered walls, the village gate, the communal house yard, the stone pillars... will definitely be the background for your vintage-style photos.

Bat Trang Ceramic Market: This 6,000m2 market sells a lot of ceramic and porcelain products, from decorative fine art items, souvenirs, to consumer goods, worship items, miniature landscape rockeries. You can completely own an item from Bat Trang Ceramic Market at an affordable price.

Van Van Ancient House: A place preserving products of craft villages, the most being Bat Trang ceramics. Located at the end of Bat Trang village, the ancient house is suitable for you to stop by, admire the collection of over 400 valuable ancient ceramic and porcelain items dating back about 500 years. Visiting hours: From 8 AM - 5:30 PM on weekdays

Bat Trang Ceramic Museum: Located in Hamlet 5, Bat Trang Commune, Bat Trang Ceramic Museum is a new check-in spot with 7 giant spirals stacked together, based on the idea of the pottery shaping wheel, with multi-faceted curved surfaces, forming a very soft undulating architectural block. In addition, this work also makes full use of local materials such as Bat Trang baked bricks and tiles to honor the rustic and simple beauty of the traditional craft village.

Ancient Bầu Kilns: Today, in Bat Trang Pottery Village, there are still 5 long-standing ancient bầu kilns, which have existed for nearly 100 years and are considered the last heritages of this pottery village. These bầu kilns were previously used to fire ceramics by manual methods, making an important contribution to the traditional ceramic production process.

activities.title: Experiences
content: Pottery making experience: Register to play pottery making for about 10,000 VND/turn. With a rotating pottery table and careful instructions on shaping and creating patterns, you can try your hand at molding pottery and creating according to your own ideas.

Visiting the ceramic production process: To create a perfect Bat Trang ceramic product, Bat Trang artisans must go through two main stages: creating the ceramic body and patterns, then glazing. Bat Trang products always have their own quality and stand out with a glossy glaze, sharp patterns, with very high durability, not worrying about damage or fading over time.

Enjoying cuisine: Bat Trang not only has ceramic specialties, but is also known for its bamboo shoot squid soup - a dish 'going to the forest and down to the sea' when combining bamboo shoots and squid very uniquely. This dish seems to be indispensable on the tray of Bat Trang people on every festival or Tet occasion. In addition, you can also enjoy delicious dishes of Hanoi or treat your stomach with super attractive snacks.

Bat Trang Pottery Village is like a living museum, where you can visit cultural relics, antiques, brick houses, as well as temples and communal houses from the 19th century, to better understand the spiritual life, customs, and festivals of the pottery village people.

Especially, during the visit to the craft village, you also get to experience the shaping process of your favorite ceramic products. The artisans in Bat Trang will advise on the types of pottery and porcelain, types of glazes as well as introduce both traditional and industrial products that the kilns in Bat Trang are producing.

activities.title: Transportation
content: Bus: From the central area (Long Bien bus station), take bus number 47A or electric bus Ecopark 02, both routes have stops right at the gate of Bat Trang village.

Car or Motorbike: From Cau Giay District, you should choose the direction through Long Bien Bridge or Chuong Duong Bridge. After crossing the bridge, turn right and continue along the Red River dyke road to reach the gate of Bat Trang village.

VAN PHUC SILK VILLAGE.name: VAN PHUC SILK VILLAGE
VAN PHUC SILK VILLAGE.introduction: Van Phuc Village is a craft village in Hanoi, possessing ancient beauty, famous for high-quality silk products and owning many photo spots that attract young people and tourists.
VAN PHUC SILK VILLAGE.location: Van Phuc Ward, Ha Dong District, Hanoi

description.title: General Introduction
content: Van Phuc Silk Weaving Village belongs to Ha Dong Ward, Hanoi. The silk village has existed for over 1000 years and is among the most famous and beautiful silk weaving villages in Vietnam.

The road to Van Phuc Village is a concrete road so you can easily get here. From the city center, you can choose the route going Nguyen Trai - Ha Dong Post Office then turn right to reach the village.

description.title: History
content: As one of the famous traditional craft villages in Hanoi, Van Phuc Silk Village has a long history, existing for over 1000 years. The former name of the village was Van Bao, but due to taboo, it was changed to Van Phuc.

1931 was the milestone marking the first time the silk weaving products of the village were promoted and introduced to the international market. At the first introduction, the silk weaving products of Van Phuc Village were highly appreciated by the French, commented as one of the most exquisite silks of Indochina.
In 1958, the silk products of the village were officially exported to Eastern European countries.

description.title: Products
content: Following the long-standing historical flow, the products of Van Phuc Silk Village to this day still maintain traditional beauty and are transformed and improved to become more diverse and eye-catching every day.

Van Phuc silk products are always well evaluated, both beautiful and durable. The material of the product is mainly made from silk so it has characteristic softness and flexibility. Combined with the skillful hands of the workers and many elaborate stages, high-quality products are created.

The decorative patterns on the silk are subtly and creatively expressed through the workers' skills such as dragons and phoenixes, embroidered silk, longevity peak pattern, four cinnamon branches, flying clouds,... The pattern decoration is symmetrical, the lines are graceful but still carry decisive and liberal features, helping the product stand out and have high aesthetics.

Each year, Van Phuc Ha Dong silk exports about 2.5 to 3 million square meters of fabric. With outstanding characteristics, Van Phuc Ha Dong silk is also often chosen as a luxurious gift for relatives, friends or partners.

The umbrella street not only has aesthetic meaning but also symbolizes the many-colored fabrics, creating a unique highlight for the silk village. Along both sides of the umbrella street are also shops close to each other displaying the characteristic and diverse products of the craft village. Especially, you can rent ao dai and take check-in photos with the unique umbrella street here.

Visiting Van Phuc Pagoda: Choosing to visit Van Phuc Silk Village, you can both admire the soft, captivating silk strips; the colorful spaces; and enjoy quiet and peaceful time of the countryside at the ancient Van Phuc Pagoda. The pagoda is located right next to the left side of the village gate with the ancient architecture of Northern pagodas. The garden space of Van Phuc Pagoda is paved with red bricks, the root of the ancient banyan tree, lotus pond, waterfall and wooden bridge have all been tinged with time. The sound of the pagoda's wooden fish, chanting mixed with the quiet atmosphere of the pagoda will bring visitors relaxing and comfortable feelings.

The location of the mural wall is in the center of the village, the surrounding space is the communal house yard so it is very spacious and airy. The colorful mural stands out in the peaceful and ancient space of the ancient village, definitely helping you have beautiful photos.

Coming to Van Phuc Ha Dong Silk Village, you definitely cannot miss the famous silk market. BELL VILLAGE.name: BELL VILLAGE
BELL VILLAGE.introduction: Chuong Village is a craft village famous throughout the country with a long tradition of making conical hats through leaf hat products. The people of Chuong Village live mainly by making leaf hats while agricultural activities are not much because this place has limited land and dense population.
BELL VILLAGE.location: Phuong Trung Commune, Thanh Oai District, Hanoi

description.title: General Introduction
content: Chuong Conical Hat Village is located in Quoc Trung Commune, Thanh Oai District, about 30 km from Hanoi capital center. Chuong Village is often known by another name as Thanh Oai Leaf Hat Village with an area of over 481 ha including 8 residential hamlets.
Chuong Village has two directions to reach: National Highway 21B to the East of the village boundary and the Day River dike to the West of the village boundary.

description.title: History of the Craft Village
content: As a long-standing craft village in Hanoi, no one knows exactly when Chuong Village started making hats. However, according to the elders in the village, from the 8th century the village had started producing hats.
At that time, Chuong Village was called Trang Thi Trung, specializing in making hats for almost all different classes in society.

During the development period, Chuong Village Hanoi was a place providing many types of traditional hats such as quai thao hats, old leaf hats with live spines. Among them, quai thao was used for the elderly to wear when going to temples. And old leaf hats with live spines served women doing farming work.

Hundreds of years have passed, the craft of weaving leaf hats in Chuong Village has become more and more prosperous. The hat weaving craft has been passed down through many generations and is one of the most famous leaf hat cradles in Hanoi. Currently, there are over 4000 households in Chuong Village weaving leaf hats, bringing cheap products and rich designs to domestic and international customers.

description.title: Characteristics of Chuong Village Hats
content: Coming to Chuong Village, you are directly admiring the production process of the leaf hat, which is a traditional craft, not for business purposes, so the people do not hide their profession. The main material to make the leaf hat is fresh corypha leaves imported from some provinces of Quang Binh, Quang Tri, while the thread and hat frame are woven from bamboo strips available locally.

Fresh corypha leaves are quite heavy and have high moisture content, so the worker needs to dry them in about 3 strong suns to let the water evaporate before starting production. The next step is to treat the leaves, which folk call roasting the leaves to make the leaves drier and softer. Then, the leaves must be air-dried and then taken for final drying before finishing the leaf treatment. At this time, the young corypha leaves will change from green to yellow.

To create a beautiful hat, first you need a solid frame. The frame is mainly woven from bamboo strips and this material is abundant along the two banks of the Day River dike. The worker needs to wrap 16 rings in layers from top to bottom according to a certain size. The next steps are sewing the leaves onto the frame and weaving the hat crown. The talent of Chuong Village workers is that the connecting knots of the weaving threads are all hidden by subtle stitching.

The weaving thread follows the needle paths with 16 layers of rings for the hat to take shape. When the hat is finished weaving, people heat it with match steam to make the hat color white and keep the hat from mold. Or you can also apply oil on the outside to make the hat shiny, glossy and even in color. While making the hat, the girls of Chuong Village decorate by sticking colorful paper flower patterns onto the hat body.

activities.title: Experiences
content: Participating in festivals: The biggest annual festival of Chuong Conical Hat Village is the festival on the 10th day of the 3rd lunar month, lasting three days from the 9th to the 11th of the 3rd lunar month. Besides, the unique point at Chuong Village is also the Market. Chuong Village Market usually opens around the 10th day of the Lunar January every year and is also the largest market of the former Ha Dong province. From then until the end of the 10th day of the 3rd lunar month is the village festival, which is also the occasion for a large market. Following the flow of history, in the old days, the market was not simply a place to buy and sell goods but a gathering place and where many folk cultural activities in the region took place. Talking about the festival at Chuong Market, the ancients had a folk song: 'On the 10th, go to Chuong Market to play, Watch human chess, watch rice cooking competition.'

Visiting Chuong Market: Chuong Village Market opens every day, specifically the hat market has six sessions a month, on the 4th, 10th, 14th, 20th, 24th and 30th of the lunar month. The market mainly sells hats and some hat weaving materials. Chuong Village Market opens quite early, at 6 AM many people in the village have come to buy. The atmosphere around the market, every household eagerly brings their family's products here to sell. The market opens early, crowded and bustling but quickly disperses after about 3 hours. People coming to the market often go quite early, those who like to visit also have to take advantage of coming very early in the morning to enjoy the bustling atmosphere of the hat market. Guests coming to Chuong Village, being present at the hat market sessions will be very excited about this unique cultural feature. It is not clear since when, but for many generations, the people of Chuong Village have maintained the habit of this market session. This is a valuable unique identity of Chuong Village.

Visiting Chuong Village Communal House: Chuong Village Communal House was built long ago in the year Giap Ngo 1894, during the 6th year of King Thanh Thai. Chuong Village Communal House is located in a beautiful position quite close to the national highway, with architecture of the characteristic Nguyen Dynasty 'inner công ngoại quốc' style, including the Trung Cung building, Hau Cung and Dai Bai. Passing through the Four-Pillar style Nghi Mon gate and the wide courtyard at Chuong Village Communal House, visitors will be overwhelmed by the architecture of the Dai Bai building. The column support system at the Dai Bai building of Chuong Village Communal House is all made from old ironwood trees with hard cores, interspersed with delicately carved panels of dragons and the four seasons (long ly quy phung – pine chrysanthemum bamboo apricot). On the panel in front of the communal house courtyard, there are 3 tigers, expressing the full liberal folk art elements. The Trung Dien and Hau Dien of Chuong Village Communal House have a similar structure, built in the stacked roof style with two roof layers. Chuong Village Communal House also preserves and displays many ancient horizontal lacquered boards, scrolls, and couplets,…

Walking around Chuong Conical Hat Village Pagoda: Chuong Conical Hat Village wears on itself an ancient beauty tinged with time, characteristic of the ancient villages in Hanoi. From the small alleys to each house with old tiled roofs, they create a nostalgic and peaceful feature of the Northern countryside. This place attracts tourists because it is an address with many photo spots. Any corner, just raise the camera and you can take a set of beautiful sparkling photos. Not only attracting by the ancient beauty, Chuong Conical Hat Village also carries a cultural beauty of the leaf hat craft village. As a traditional Vietnamese craft village, when walking around Chuong Conical Hat Village, you will encounter people and households making leaf hats with many cute traditional styles of the Vietnamese people. This is truly a precious experience for any Vietnamese child.

activities.title: Cuisine
content: Chuong Village rolled rice cake: Chuong Conical Hat Village has a very famous rolled rice cake throughout the region.

Peanut solidified rice cake: At Chuong Market, there is also peanut solidified rice cake sold a lot in each market session, which is also a simple delicious dish associated with the life of the people.

activities.title: Transportation
content: From Hanoi, tourists go along National Highway 6 in the direction of Hoa Bình. After going in the direction of Huong Pagoda about 2km from Kim Bai town, then turn right at the three-way intersection to reach Chuong Conical Hat Village right on the bank of the Day River. As a long-standing leaf hat village lying quietly next to the Day River, Chuong Conical Hat Village possesses the rustic and traditional beauty of the Northern countryside, combined with the unique beauty that the leaf hat production craft brings. If you are a traveler from afar, remember to come to Chuong Village when you have the opportunity to travel to Hanoi to explore and find the simple and honest ancient beauties of the nation as well as the history of Chuong Conical Hat Village and the formation and development of this village.

PHU DONG VILLAGE.name: PHU DONG VILLAGE
PHU DONG VILLAGE.introduction: Phu Dong Giong Temple is an ancient temple imbued with traditional Vietnamese architecture. This place is associated with the legend of the national hero Saint Giong. Every space in the temple evokes national historical pride in the hearts of visitors.
PHU DONG VILLAGE.location: Phu Dong Commune, Gia Lam District, Hanoi

description.title: General Introduction
content: Phu Dong Giong Temple (Phu Dong Temple) is located in Phu Dong Commune, Gia Lam District, Hanoi. This is a land rich in historical traditions in the Capital.
The temple faces South, leaning against the Duong River dike, creating a both poetic and ancient scene.
The temple is a complex of structures including the five-door gate, water pavilion, front hall, middle hall and back sanctuary.

The temple is a living proof of the interference of architectural styles from the Ly Dynasty to the Nguyen Dynasty. Phu Dong Temple is also a symbolic temple associated with the famous Saint Giong legend.

description.title: Formation History
content: Phu Dong Giong Temple belongs to the Phu Dong historical relic complex and was built to commemorate Saint Giong - the national hero who contributed to driving away the invading Yin enemies. To this day, Saint Giong Temple still retains its cultural value and becomes a historical symbol, the pride of many Vietnamese children.
Hung King Period: Phu Dong Giong Temple was built to worship Saint Giong. According to流传 legends, the temple was built on the foundation of Saint Giong's mother's house.

Late 11th century: Under the dynasty of King Ly Thai To, Phu Dong Giong Temple was renovated for the first time. The temple became a place to organize the annual Giong Festival to commemorate the merits of Saint Giong in defeating the Yin invaders.
17th century: During the Restored Le period, the water pavilion of the temple was built, applying the art of delicate carving of familiar folk scenes.
17th – 18th centuries: Dien Quan Cong Nguyen Huy and Trang Nguyen Dang Cong Chat contributed to building the temple's front houses and also contributed many other valuable artifacts.

Currently, Phu Dong Giong Temple is preserving 21 ordinations from many dynasties such as the Le, Tay Son and Nguyen dynasties, the oldest known ordination is from 1634. The temple is preserving many other valuable artifacts such as the worship throne, bronze unicorns, incense burners and a pair of cranes with strong Chinese characteristics.

description.title: Legend of Saint Giong
content: Saint Giong, also known as Phu Dong Thien Vuong, is one of the four immortal saints in Vietnamese folk beliefs.
The legend of Saint Giong is associated with the time of the 6th Hung King and has been passed down by the people for generations.
The story tells that, a 60-year-old woman after stepping into a giant footprint became pregnant and gave birth to a boy named Giong. At three years old, the boy Giong still could not speak or walk.
When the Yin invaders invaded, Giong suddenly asked King Hung to forge for him a horse, sword, and iron armor. After eating his fill, Giong grew rapidly and went to defeat the Yin invaders.
After the victory, he took off his armor and flew straight up to the sky. Later, he was worshiped by the people as a national hero symbol.

activities.title: Visiting

activities.title: Visiting
content: Participating in the Festival: The Phu Dong Temple Festival takes place from the 6th to the 9th day of the 4th lunar month every year, attracting a large number of local people and tourists to participate. activities.title: Transportation
content: Phu Dong Temple is about 21 km from Hanoi Capital center, so it is quite convenient for tourists to come to learn about Vietnamese history and culture. To get to Phu Dong Giong Temple Hanoi, tourists have many different travel choices.

activities.title: Notes
content: You need to prepare polite clothing when visiting the temple, prioritize choosing long-sleeved clothes, if wearing a skirt, it should be below the knee. You also need to avoid clothes that are too thin or too tight.
Visitors need to walk lightly and speak softly, avoid making noisy actions or joking too much. The temple space is a sacred place, requiring quiet and solemnity.

The worship hall area does not allow photography, so you need to pay special attention to this point. If you want to keep images at the temple, you need to ask the management board to know the allowed photo locations.

Visitors avoid touching artifacts with their hands, do not litter and have actions that damage trees in the campus. Because the temple is an intangible cultural heritage, it needs to be protected by everyone.
Visitors need to be careful in preserving personal belongings, beware of thieves taking advantage of crowds, especially during the festival season to perform theft and pickpocketing.

SUGAR CANE PAGODA.introduction: Mia Pagoda Son Tay is an ancient gem in Duong Lam ancient village. This place stands out with traditional architecture and a rich system of Buddha statues. Not only a spiritual destination, the pagoda also carries strong historical and cultural imprints.
SUGAR CANE PAGODA.location: Duong Lam Commune, Son Tay Town, Hanoi

description.title: General Introduction
content: Mia Pagoda, also known as Sung Nghiem Tu, is located on high land near Tich River. The pagoda faces Southwest, meaning both towards wisdom (South) and wishing the gods to settle (West). Mia Pagoda in Duong Lam ancient village is one of the few pagodas in Hanoi that still preserves traditional architecture. This place is also associated with the sacredness and anecdotes about the Sugar Cane Princess.
This is one of the typical ancient pagodas of the Xu Doai region, still preserving the original traditional architecture to this day.
Mia Pagoda is associated with the land that gave birth to many famous people such as Ngo Quyen, Phung Hung, Ly Bi.
The pagoda is also famous for being the place that preserves the largest number of artistic statues in Vietnam with 287 statues.

description.title: History
content: Initially, Mia Pagoda was only a small pagoda, existing for a very long time. By 1632, this place fell into disrepair. In 1632, the concubine Ngo Thi Ngoc Dieu (also known as Nguyen Thi Ngoc Dong) – from Nam Nguyen village (Nam An), together with her parents and people in the area, stood up to renovate and expand the scale of the pagoda. Thanks to the renovation efforts, she was respectfully called 'Sugar Cane Princess' by the people. Having undergone many repairs, but to this day, the architecture from the time of the Sugar Cane Princess is still preserved intact.

description.title: Architecture
content: Mia Pagoda bears the strong imprint of traditional Vietnamese pagoda architecture, with a harmonious layout and majestic scale. The pagoda is built in the shape of the Chinese character 'Muc', divided into three separate areas: a spacious garden space, a solemn inner hall area, and a surrounding Arhat corridor.

Passing through the three-entrance gate, visitors will see the row of vegetarian houses – where monks live. The main hall area includes many important items such as the Ceremonial Hall, the Lower Pagoda, the Inner Pagoda and the Upper Hall, creating a harmonious overall, bearing the strong imprint of traditional Vietnamese pagoda architecture.

Going deeper inside is the inner hall area, including the front hall, the precious hall, the great hero and the upper hall. The architecture here has the characteristics of the 'inner công ngoại quốc' style – a traditional style in building Vietnamese pagodas. description.title: Buddha Statue System
content: Mia Pagoda is considered a precious treasure of Buddhist sculpture with 287 statues of various sizes and materials. Among them, there are 6 statues cast in bronze, 106 statues carved from wood and 174 statues made of mixed earth, exquisitely lacquered and gilded.

Typical statues: Tuyet Son Statue, Ba Dai Hoa Thuong Statue, Sugar Cane Princess Statue, Nam Hai Quan Am Statue. Tuyet Son Statue: Carved from jackfruit wood, about 3 meters high, depicting the image of Buddha Shakyamuni during the ascetic practice period. The statue has a majestic demeanor, a thin appearance but exuding determination, placed in the Upper Hall area. Ba Dai Hoa Thuong Statue: The statue is about 2 meters high, depicting the image of a monk with a benevolent appearance and a kind smile. The statue is placed in the center of the front hall, one of the statues worshiped by many people. Sugar Cane Princess Statue: Made from jackfruit wood, about 1.5 meters high, depicting the image of a dignified and gentle woman. The statue is worshiped solemnly in the wooden cabinet next to the Three Jewels Hall, showing the respect of the people for the woman who contributed greatly to the pagoda renovation. Nam Hai Quan Am Statue: The jackfruit wood statue is about 2 meters high, carrying the compassionate and kind demeanor of Quan The Am Bo Tat. The statue is placed in the Arhat corridor, a stopping point for many Buddhists and tourists when coming to worship.
